title: Relationship Graph Types
description: An interactive visualization demonstrating different types of relationships (prerequisite, related to, contrasts with, exemplifies, influences) that can be represented in educational knowledge graphs.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Education
Knowledge Graphs
Concept Mapping
Data Visualization
learningObjectives: Identify five common relationship types used in knowledge graphs
Distinguish between directional and bidirectional relationships
Apply appropriate relationship types when creating concept maps
Analyze existing diagrams to identify relationship patterns

controls.name: Legend Items
controls.description: Click on legend items to highlight edges of that relationship type

controls.name: Empty Space
controls.description: Click on empty space to reset highlighting

edgeTypes.name: Prerequisites
edgeTypes.description: Concept A must be learned before Concept B

edgeTypes.name: Related to
edgeTypes.description: Concepts share common themes or overlap

edgeTypes.name: Contrasts with
edgeTypes.description: Concepts are opposites or differ significantly

edgeTypes.name: Exemplifies
edgeTypes.description: Concept A is an example or instance of Concept B

edgeTypes.name: Influences
edgeTypes.description: Concept A affects or shapes Concept B
